title: 3DTitles & EZTitles v4 Incl Crack English-SURYADEWA
description:
3DTitles

3DTitles adds depth to your regular 2D subtitles.
It automatically calculates it when the subtitle hits the screen!
Or YOU can do it according to point of interest in the picture.

The worldÃ¢â‚¬â„¢s easiest 3D subtitling solution
The only constant in a world of rapidly improving technology is change.
Not so long ago considered as a high-end feature with limited usage, nowadays 3D TV and movies are getting more and more popular. Recently, many major studios have stated their plans to migrate many of their features to 3D. Television manufacturers, on the other hand, have already launched 3D-ready models, with promises that many more will come. There have been announcements of 3D broadcast channels in America, Europe and Asia.
Soon 3D, like HD not so long ago, will have a major impact in the TV and movies industry. And the majority of our programs and movies will come to life. Will the subtitling industry stall?
Not for long.
3DTitles is here to help you prepare and deliver high quality 3D subtitles. And it is fully compatible with some of the most significant 3D technologies and file formats, ensuring compatibility with Sony Blu-ray BDN XML with 3D Stereoscopic extensions format along with Final Cut ProÃ‚Â® XML and EDL file formats. The files 3DTitles creates can be used as well with AVIDÃ‚Â® and AdobeÃ‚Â® PremiereÃ‚Â® with ease.

Subtitles are turning to a new dimension
While for quite sometime it was considered that 2D subtitles can simply be applied to 3D material the overall result is not convenient. If the subtitles are not properly depth positioned within the 3D space they will seem out of place most of time, ruining both the whole 3D illusion and viewerÃ¢â‚¬â„¢s experience.
The possibility of adding depth to the subtitles became a must as it enables to appear properly on the screen for every viewerÃ¢â‚¬â„¢s convenience.
The vast majority of the process of adding depth to standard 2D subtitles is fully automated with 3DTitles. With the help of our integrated real time auto-depth detecting system the program will automatically estimate the depth of the subtitles. And if the automation result is not satisfying the subtitler just have to choose the point of interest to which the subtitle shall be positioned to and simply click. 3DTitles will automatically calculate the necessary depth and apply it for the chosen subtitle.

In a new, dynamic position
For a proper display of the subtitles in 3D TV or cinema they have to remain perfectly positioned within the 3-dimensional space according to the dynamically changing points of interest. But at some point a single subtitle may stay on the screen for more than one shot. And it has to remain easy to read in relation to the changed point of interest when the new shot hits the screen.
Luckily, 3DTitles has an answer for this kind of issues. A single subtitleÃ¢â‚¬â„¢s depth position can be changed as many of times as needed in order for the text to remain perfectly positioned in all conditions.
Finally, 3DTitles is fully compatible with your existing 2D subtitle files. And each subtitleÃ¢â‚¬â„¢s depth position can be recorded into the original file for simplicity.

__________________________________________________________

EZTitles

Open/DVD and Teletext Subtitles, Closed Captions
EZTitles is designed to work as a world-class professional subtitling software. It meets all the requirements of the TV broadcast, film, DVD and Blu-ray standards.

SD and HD resolutions
The subtitles can be prepared both in SD and HD resolutions in different aspect ratios. PAL and NTSC resolution in 4x3 and 16x9 (anamorphic) mode, HD 720, HD 1080 are supported.

For most popular DVD authoring systems
In SD and HD resolutions. Text script formats and high quality anti-aliased images are available for the following systems: Sonic Scenarist HDMV (Blu-ray) and Advanced Contents (HD-DVD), AdobeÃ‚Â® EncoreÃ‚Â® DVD, AppleÃ‚Â® DVD Studio ProÃ‚Â®, Spruce DVD Maestro, Final Cut ProÃ‚Â®, etc.

Aspect Ratio and Letterbox Options
We are aware that there might be additional requirements for the textÃ¢â‚¬â„¢s position for letterboxed videos and thatÃ¢â‚¬â„¢s why EZTitles introduces several options which are designed to help you in this case.
Furthermore by setting the correct Aspect Ratio and Letterboxing you will have an instant view of how your subtitles fit to the picture.

In most popular subtitle formats
PAC, 890, EBU, ASCII, Unicode ASCII, Windows Media Player SAMI, Win2020 ASCII, DAS, Softitler TXT as well as Custom defined format.

In any language
EZTitles supports all European languages plus Chinese, Korean, Japanese, Arabic, Hebrew, Vietnamese, Hindi and Thai.

Digital Cinema Ready
Supports Texas Instruments CineCanvas XML- based subtitles for DLP Cinema projection system and the SMPTE 428-7-2007 DCDM (Digital Cinema Distribution Master) XML specifications.

Comprehensive checks
Done in background, they indicate inconsistent cues, reading speed and safe area problems. The Checks command allows you to check against various conditions: cues and reading speed problems, safe area, raised subtitles, intervals between subtitles, etc.

In Colors
EZTitles supports color subtitles in Teletext and Open/DVD modes. The limitations of the currently chosen format or authoring system are considered.
